item.description:
please bring something to sit on?/lawn chair? 

I'm Steve, I live in Northfield, and would like people to hike and socialize at my home. I would provide coffee, juice, bagles, and scones for all who attend. My home is located on the M+M trail, and there is a great hike that starts at my house, and is about three or so miles long round trip.There are open fields,woods and water for the dogs to explore.We could have the social before or after the hike,which ever people prefer. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Steve and Hank’s driveway is right next to a trail marker for the M+M trail, which is on the north side of his road (pic on the left). This part of the M+M trail is section 16.  The trail continues across the street and west a few feet from his house, on the south side of his road (pic on the right). Our walk will be starting at this point of the trail and going south. Our trail guides Steve and Hank, can show us a loop walk in which we will walk on the trail, cut through some fields to meet with Mountain Road, and take the road back to his house. Steve indicates that there is very little traffic on this road and he rarely sees a car when he takes his dogs on this loop walk. Another option he has is to just walk on the trail for an amount of time and then retrace our steps back. We can discuss when we meet.

If we do the loop, he warns that part of the walk goes by a neighbor that has some farm animals inside an electric fence. He just went out a couple days ago and the Black Flies are already out. Ticks are a natural part of this area as well. Repellants and checking for ticks is advised for both you and your dogs.  The walk is mostly flat so no steep hills will be encountered.  As we always start our walks, dogs should be on leash until we know how they will get along. 

Steve is open to agenda suggestions as to whether people want to do either A or B below. You can contact Steve via email or post a comment.

 A) come and meet at his house, have coffee/snacks and socialize, and then go on the walk

 B) meet at his house, go on the walk, and then after the walk have the coffee/snacks and socialize.

Meetup at Steve’s house is for 9AM but he is open for people to come earlier, if so desired. He says he won’t be up at 5AM though.

Steve indicates these directions are the best way to get to his house from Greenfield/Springfield.

  • From I-91N, take Exit 28A, the RT-10N exit in Bernardston
  • At the end of the ramp, turn slight RIGHT onto RT-10/Church St., continuing on RT-10 for 4.4 miles until you meet up with RT-63 and you must take a left or a right.
  • Turn LEFT onto RT-10/RT-63, which is also MAIN St., for 0.3 miles.
  • Take 1st RIGHT onto MAPLE ST.   After about 1 mile, MAPLE ST turns into GULF ROAD. 
  • Continue on GULF ROAD for 3.9 miles.

 Note that MAPLE ST is 0.1 mi past Lorita Lane on the left. If you reach Warwick Road, which is the next right after MAPLE ST, you have gone about 0.4 mi too far.

  • Turn RIGHT onto SOUTH MOUNTAIN ROAD and go for about 0.6 miles. Steve’s driveway is on the right at the top of a hill.

Note if you reach an intersection with Old Wendell Road on the right and Mountain Road on the left, you have passed Steve’s house.

Google maps put Steve’s house at the intersection of South Mountain Rd and Old Wendell Rd. These directions/maps are from Mapquest, which is correct.

﻿http://home.comcast.net/~tm01001/fytosmr.htm is a link for this section. We will not be doing the entire section but for another time, and if anyone is interested, this section has some beautiful views and goes near Hermit’s Cave.

http://www.everytrail.com/view_trip.php?trip_id=125420 is another link with pictures.

group.name: Western Mass Dogs - Walks and more!

item.name: Hank and Steve's
